channel.title: BBC News - Business
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Food firm in 'drastic' action amid driver shortage
item.description: Wholesaler Country Range says it is buying smaller vans to get round the lack of HGV drivers.

item.title: Sports Direct owner's new boss offered potential £100m bonus
item.description: Michael Murray, Mike Ashley's future son-in-law, must more than double the firm's share price.

item.title: NHS stops some blood tests due to vial shortages
item.description: Doctors across the country are being asked to delay tests due to a nationwide shortage of blood test tubes.

item.title: Uber and union bosses to meet after landmark deal on workers' rights
item.description: GMB and Uber pledge to end the "exploitation" of drivers who work for ride-hailing apps.

item.title: Contactless payments dominated as lockdowns eased
item.description: Spending on cards rose inevitably in May as Covid restrictions were lifted, says UK Finance.

item.title: Covid: Qantas says pandemic to cost billions in lost revenue
item.description: The Australian airline's boss described trading conditions as "diabolical", even domestically.

item.title: Car production in July hits lowest level since 1956
item.description: Microchip shortages and staff being told to self-isolate has contributed to shortages in production.

item.title: South Korea becomes first major Asian economy to raise interest rates
item.description: The move comes as central banks around the world prepare to exit emergency stimulus measures.

item.title: Tesco and Iceland bosses warn over Christmas supplies
item.description: But Tesco's chairman says don't "overdramatise" lorry driver crisis, as Iceland warns problem getting worse.

item.title: Delta Airlines imposes $200 monthly surcharge on unvaccinated staff
item.description: The US airline also says Covid sufferers won't get sick pay unless they are double-jabbed.

item.title: Amigo warns of collapse as losses jump and compensation payouts rise
item.description: Sub-prime lender Amigo faces a £345m compensation bill for mis-selling and warns it may not survive.

item.title: Why rent control isn’t working in Sweden
item.description: Young people are struggling to afford city living, and even the Swedes can't crack the problem.

item.title: Mr Kipling maker Premier Foods offers staff hybrid working
item.description: Premier Foods says office staff can work "wherever they work best", starting from this month.

item.title: UK self-catering holiday prices soar in pandemic
item.description: Holidaymakers are paying an average of £300 more per week than before the pandemic, analysis suggests.

item.title: Just Eat announces 1,500 new jobs in North East
item.description: The food delivery platform will invest £100m to create 1,500 new customer service roles.

item.title: EY fined £3.5m for failures over 2017 Stagecoach audit
item.description: The Big Four accountancy firm is fined £3.5m for failures over the 2017 audit of the bus and coach company.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Can the US crack down on fake vaccination cards?
item.description: As more people are asked to prove vaccination status, a black market in fake health cards has boomed.

item.title: How to keep your cool when the office heats up
item.description: Buildings that are too hot are bad for your health and productivity but simple measures can help.

item.title: Why phone scams are so difficult to tackle
item.description: Phone fraud, both via calls and text messages, has soared during the pandemic.

item.title: Brazil hopes the world will get a taste for its favourite spirit
item.description: With domestic sales of cachaça falling last year, Brazilian producers want to export more.

item.title: Love and money: Why breaking-up is so hard to do
item.description: More people are looking for help in paying for divorces after relationships ended during Covid.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Don't ask for all your funding up front
item.description: Don't ask for all your funding at once, says Zazuu CEO Kay Akinwunmi, but in smaller chunks.

item.title: Never mind going electric, where will we park?
item.description: UK roads are already jam-packed and that looks set to get worse as more people snap up EVs.

item.title: Just how hard is it to recycle a jumbo jet?
item.description: Thousands of aircraft were left on the tarmac due to Covid, and many will now be broken up for parts.

item.title: Would you let a robot lawyer defend you?
item.description: Why artificial intelligence is increasingly being used by the legal profession.
